ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write a literature review
how to conduct and research study and analyze data
I learned how to write a very long paper. I also learned quite a bit of statistics that I needed to use to analyze my data for my project.
I learned hands-on lab skills and was able to take the data that I generated and analyze/draw conclusions from it.
SO much about a topic that I'm super interested in and will benefit my future! :)

Doing an independent literature review not only taught me a lot about my thesis topic but about how I work and what I need to do to meet my self-imposed deadlines. Doing a PSYC 499 is a lesson in self-discipline. I wrote the first big draft over October Break and worked on several drafts with my advisor between then and Dec 3. I would recommend that folks do some introspection on how they work best and what support they need from their advisor before doing a PSYC 499 thesis.

By conducting my own study, I gained a lot of insight into the research process, from experiment design through implementation. As I was able to integrate my real-world passions and academic interests, I feel the Independent Study was a culmination of my academic work in PSYC.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths were that the course was hands off and I was able to do a lot of the work on my own. No weaknesses
i think the strength and weakness of this course is that it's very independent -- more structure would have been nice.

This course is largely what you make of it. I had a fantastic research adviser that I have been working with since my second year at Yale, so I received a lot of great guidance. I can imagine this course would not be very good if your research advisor wasn't willing to spend a significant amount of time working with you and providing feedback.
This course is a great opportunity to conduct empirical research for the senior requirement rather than produce a literature review. I enjoyed how self-directed it is.

Strength: Great opportunity to delve into one specific area of interest. Weakness: I wish I could have written more in first-person. I think a page of *very loose* recommendations might be helpful for students in the future.  :)

It's super individual and dependent on your relationship with your advisor so it's hard to say. I think the fact that this is largely independent work is a strength and a weakness - you need to get it done on your own but you can get overwhelmed at times. Setting mini deadlines with your advisor is very helpful.

I appreciated how flexible the department was in allowing me to design my senior essay project and to work with an advisor that is not formally affiliated with the undergraduate PSYC department. In the future, I would recommend that the PSYC department provide more support in helping students design projects aligned with their passions and in helping them locate advisors, so that students do not feel that completing the senior essay requirement through a seminar is the only viable option.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It was a great way to do a senior thesis!
yes, definitely a very worthwhile course.
This course is required for the psychology major.
I would highly recommend this option to psych seniors for the senior requirement.

Yes. I think it is what you make of it! It was an unbelievable amount of work for me, but I imagine a lot less could be done. It's so cool to walk away from this place with a paper I'm truly proud of and may even help me get a job someday!  :)

If you are interested in a topic that is not covered by a psych lab or senior seminar - do this! I wanted to be very passionate about my thesis topic and the PSYC 499 credit was the way to go for me because I had no restrictions or prompts.

I am so grateful that I conducted an Independent Study for my senior thesis (rather than completing my thesis through a senior seminar, as I originally planned to). Whereas writing the essay in a seminar would have required me to adapt my paper to fit the themes of a course or interests of a professor, the Independent Study offers flexibility to design a project that resonates deeply with your own interests. If you have a project you would be passionate about, I would highly recommend pursuing the Independent Study, and not being deterred if you are a BA student. Be open to creative possibilities for your senior essay topic and advisor (including looking outside the PSYC department, if appropriate), and do not feel pressured to adapt your topic to fit those of an existing lab, advisor, or PSYC seminar.
